Stats

Biography

Enters first year at Lenoir-Rhyne after four years at Towson.

2023: Competed in all 15 games primarily in the midfield, having two starts on the attack line... finished the year with 10 points off six goals and four assists, adding five ground balls... had a goal in three consecutive games from Feb. 18-Mar. 1, including two goals and an assist vs. No. 7 Loyola (3/1)... member of the CAA Commissioner's Academic Honor Roll.

2022: Played in all 16 games as a junior midfielder … posted 11 points with seven goals and four assists … notched his first career goal against Richmond (Feb. 26) … had a career-best three points (2g, 1a) at Saint Joseph’s (March 11) … added two goals against Delaware (April 16) during the regular season … scored one goal and one assist against UMass (May 5) during the CAA Tournament … took 26 total shots, putting 16 of those chances on net … had four ground balls and one caused turnover while not serving a penalty all season.

2021: Played in four games as a redshirt freshman … made his first career appearance against No. 1 Duke (Feb. 20) … started his first-ever game against No. 12 Loyola (March 27) … finished with two assists, logging his first career point against Duke … added an assist in the home game against Delaware (April 24).

2020 Season: Did not see the field as a rookie midfielder.

High School: played midfield at Bullis for head coach Jeff Bellistri … helped team to GEICO High School Lacrosse National Championship back-to-back IAC championships … finished his high school career with 35 goals and 18 assists … All-IAC junior and senior year … honor roll and high honor roll student.

Personal: Son of Randy and April Bender … has a sister, Nicole … father played football at Colorado … person he most admires is his grandfather … favorite hobbies are fishing and golf … favorite professional sports teams are the Washington Redskins and Capitals … favorite professional athlete is Tom Brady … favorite movie is The Other Guys … most memorable experience was winning his first championship … majoring in business at Towson.
